result.execSummary:
The defendant Avery J. Schaeffer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant's record shall be expunged per Section 973.015 Wis Stats if probation is successfully completed.
Defendant shall submit to any assessments and fully participate in any counseling deemed appropriate by the Agent and abide by any treatment recommendations.
Defendant shall receive Alcohol and other Drug assessment from a licensed agency as determined by Probation Agent and follow any treatment recommendations.

Elements

Defendant Avery J. Schaeffer in court with attorney Nathaniel J. Wojan. 
Veronica Isherwood appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Plea Questionnaire / Waiver of Rights filed with the Court. 
Court questions defendant and advises of rights. 
No contest plea entered on Count 2. 
State has not complied with victim notification, but informs Court victim did not request to be notified. 
Court accepts plea to Count 2 and finds defendant guilty. 
Count 3 is dismissed and read in. 
Count 1 applies to codefendant. 
Sentence withheld, ordered 12 months Probation. 
Conditions: 
- pay costs/supervision fees 
- submit to assessments/counseling and abide by recommendations 
- AODA assessment and abide by recommendations 
- maintain absolute sobriety 
- expungement upon successful completion of probation 
Advised of appeal rights.
